embeds.title: Minor Beam
embeds.description:
Special Attack / 0 :e_colorless: / Colorless / Downfall

Deal 5 (7) damage.
**Encode.**

messages.content: this is a very very good card. 7 damage a turn that lets you make at least one function every turn. I've had runs where I just had 3 of these and dealt 42 damage every turn without even factoring strength or any other cards in my deck. It has great synergies with so many of automation's rare cards. Dev tools, Virus, Library and Summon orb all benefit greatly from such a reliable source of Function cards.
I think theres 2 ways to play functions with automation. One of them is to have a dedicated plan with a few carefully selected function cards and attempt to follow that plan each fight.
oh yeah this card is so good with dev tools
kinda like a 2nd replicate in your deck

The other way is to just create functions as fast as possible since any function is going to be far above the powerlevel of a normal card and infinite beams is on the the mean enablers of that playstyle.
i gotta say @ocean the auto join threads feature is awesome
i was manually joining every one before
had to be done

I've found that decks with thoughtless function spam tend to be the most consistent way to win. Infinite beams and Virus are the too cards that make me think that; especially Virus being a card you can just take and have it carry you across the whole game.
<?automaton in=fragment>

embeds.title: Virus
embeds.description:
Rare Attack / 1 :e_automaton: / The Automaton / Downfall

**Retain**.
Deal 5 (6) damage.
**Transform** all cards in hand into Minor Beam. (+.)

messages.content: oh i thought virus made fragments
congratulations, you somehow made virus even more broken

I largely agree with ahoodedman. Most of my success with the automaton has been making as many completely random functions as fast as I can. The reality is that stapling three cards together, putting the end result immediately into your hand, and making it cost 1 is just incredibly powerful. It really doesn't matter what the three cards were, almost any function will be fantastic.

Infinite beams is the perfect card to represent this idea (spaghetti code also does a similar thing once). Once it's in play, you will likely be making at least 1 function a turn, while also dealing significant damage for 0 energy. That completed function will by hyper efficient and will help carry you through the current turn. Any form of strength scaling can amplify this significantly, since it applies to every hit on a function. The upgrade for infinite beams is also insane, not just making the minor beam deal 2 more damage, but letting each completed function deal that additional damage as well, every time you draw it.

Generally with infinite beams, you will want to prioritize encode cards that block a little higher, as it tends to provide all the damage you will need over the course of the run. Branch, frontload, and fragmentare all helpful to fill in that gap. A copy of sentient form can also help scale the damage even further into the late game, or you can use boost for smaller, more immediate strength scaling for the minor beams. 

It's strong against all 3 act 1 elites, helping you scale for lagavulin if you play it while it's asleep, deal damage against nob, and deal damage faster/mitigate the dazes against tri-sentries. It can also represent enough function scaling to get past most act 1 bosses. It's a card I'm very happy to see in act 1, and will still likely take even in act 3 if I need to make functions faster. Goes really well with the ninja relics and pen nib, both supplying cheap 0 energy attacks, and creating more 1 energy attacks via functions.

It probably deserves a nerf of some kind, maybe have the upgrade lower the cost rather than upgrade the minor beams? The upgrade stands out as being particularly powerful right now. As long as minor beam continues to be a 0 cost attack with encode, I can't see any version of this card that isn't very strong.
What if it was changed to 2(1) cost unupgraded minor beams?
make it innate :awaken:
Innate powers yucky
i think nerfing Minor Beam is the best course of action, as it seems not coincidental that both Minor Beam cards are amazing (this and <Virus>)
